records.Name: Ladyfinger cactus
records.Water__c: Typical water needs for a succulent
records.Watering__c:
Mammillaria elongata has typical water needs for a succulent. It’s best to use the “soak and dry” method, and allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings.

In the winter when it is dormant, water only sparingly, if at all, to prevent rot.
records.Where_to_plant__c: Mammillaria elongata “Ladyfinger Cactus” is not cold hardy, so if you live in a zone that gets colder than 20° F (-6.7° C), it’s best to plant this succulent in a container that can be brought indoors. It does well in full to partial sun.

records.Name: Ruby Glow
records.Water__c: Typical water needs for a succulent
records.Watering__c: Peperomia graveolens has typical watering needs for a succulent. It’s best to use the “soak and dry” method, and allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings.
records.Where_to_plant__c: “Ruby Glow” is not cold hardy, so if you live in a zone that gets colder than 20° F (-6.7° C), it’s best to plant this succulent in a container that can be brought indoors. It does well in full to partial sun.

records.Name: Jelly Beans
records.Offset_Propogation__c: To grow ?Jelly Beans? from cuttings use a sterile sharp knife or pair of scissors. Remove a stem from the main plant and allow it to callous for several days before placing on well-draining soil. Water whenever the soil has dried out completely.
records.Watering__c: Sedum pachyphyllum has typical watering needs for a succulent. Its best to use the soak and dry method and allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings.

records.Name: Blue Chalksticks
records.Water__c: Typical water needs for a succulent

records.Name: Tom Thumb
records.Offset_Propogation__c: ‘Tom Thumb’ will produce small offsets, sprouting up around the base of the plant. Simply pull these up and allow the offsets to dry for one to two days before replanting.
records.Water__c: Typical water needs for a succulent
records.Watering__c: Crassula ‘Tom Thumb’ has typical watering needs for a succulent. It’s best to use the “soak and dry” method, and allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings.
records.Where_to_plant__c: Crassula ‘Tom Thumb’ is not cold hardy, so if you live in a zone that gets colder than 30° F (-1.1° C), it’s best to plant this succulent in a container that can be brought indoors. It does well in full to partial sun.

records.Name: Sedum clavatum
records.Water__c: Typical water needs for a succulent

records.Name: Propeller Plant
records.Offset_Propogation__c: Crassula falcata will self-propagate, growing offsets. Cut the offsets off from the main stem with a sharp, sterile knife or scissors. Allow the offsets to dry for one to two days before laying on well-draining soil.
records.Water__c: Typical water needs for a succulent. Be careful not to over-water
records.Watering__c: Propeller Plant has the same watering needs as most succulents. It’s best to water using the “soak and dry” method. Be sure to allow the soil to dry out completely before watering again.
records.Where_to_plant__c: Crassula falcata is one of the few succulents that does well indoors. Plant it in a container near a sunny window.

records.Name: Echeveria Lola
records.Water__c: Be careful not to over-water to avoid pests and root rot
